meanings.definition: A disadvantage imposed on a person or group due to a disability or other circumstance.
meanings.sent1: The student overcame his handicaps and excelled in school.
meanings.sent2: The handicaps faced by the team made it challenging for them to win the game.
meanings.sent3: Despite his handicaps, he always had a positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: The handicaps of poverty weighed heavily on the community.
meanings.sent5: Her handicaps did not define her; she was determined to succeed.

meanings.definition: A race or contest in which certain disadvantages or advantages are given to equalize the chances of winning.
meanings.sent1: The golf tournament had handicaps to level the playing field.
meanings.sent2: In the handicaps, the slower runners were given a head start.
meanings.sent3: The handicaps in the chess match added an interesting twist.
meanings.sent4: The handicaps in the game made it more exciting and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The handicaps in the competition made it fair for all participants.

meanings.definition: To hinder or impede the progress or development of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His fear of failure handicaps him from taking risks.
meanings.sent2: Procrastination can handicap your ability to achieve your goals.
meanings.sent3: Don't let self-doubt handicap your potential for success.
meanings.sent4: The lack of resources can handicap a small business.
meanings.sent5: Negative thinking can handicap your creativity and innovation.
